event.name: COALITION_FED_RECON
event.text: The beacon seems to be little more than a planet with a small industrialized settlement.
After a short pause, a Federation Recon decloaks nearby and hails you. "Ah, an ally! We've been performing reconnaissance here. Let me explain."
As you prepare to attack them, the Federation ship seems to fumble for their weapons. They weren't expecting you to attack.

choice.text: (Adv. Sensors) Something is off. Do a deep scan of the region.

event.text: Your sensors detect a cloaked Federation ship. It's trying to avoid detection from the planet below - and seemingly you as well.
The ship decloaks, their response is curt. "What do you want? You're going to jeopardize our mission."
"Is that so? Fine. We'll explain."
"Damn it! I knew they couldn't be trusted!" You hear them say, as they rush to their battlestations.
As soon as you force them to decloak, they approach you at an attack vector. "We know how you operate, Renegade! You catch us off guard!"
There's nothing more to do here, except perhaps some activity on your ship.

event.name: RECON_EXPLAIN_MISSION
event.text: "This planet is a production facility for high-end Coalition equipment. Best case scenario, we sabotage it without them becoming the wiser. We've already developed viruses that, if introduced locally, will compromise all their systems. That's the best long-term solution. If we can't, then destroying it is probably fine, but it's got serious defenses. We don't have the resources to launch an assault, so we're just gathering intel... but you? You could sabotage it or interfere. What do you say?"

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Create a gap in their security.

event.text: You exploit a vulnerability in the production facility's defense grid. You can either slip in undetected, or deactivate their ability to call for help as you blow them up.

You and the Federation Recon bombard the surface of the planet with your weapons systems. While they catch on and try to call for help or respond by using their defense grid, your hack prevents them from taking any action to defend themselves. The loss of this facility is likely to be noticed before too long, but you're still able to recover some salvage from the wreckage.

choice.text: (Teleporter) Beam down into a sensitive area.

event.text: As you seize control of the security systems, you send some crew down, and make sure that the system is unaware of their presence.
"That's... it? That's all you were able to do...? I guess we'll just... take advantage of this security flaw at some point." The recon returns to its hiding spot.

choice.text: (Upg. Mind Control) Clear one of your shuttles for landing.

event.text: Since this facility is not in a nebula, it is mostly staffed by Mantises and Rockmen. It's not difficult to sway one of them to sneak your shuttle through security.

You and the Federation Recon bombard the surface of the planet with your powerful weapons systems. Your overwhelming force destroys the production facility before they even realize what is happening. The loss of this facility is likely to be noticed before too long, but you're still able to recover some salvage from the wreckage.
"You can't help, huh? Well, that's a shame. We'll bide our time, then." The recon returns to its hiding spot.

The facility produces top grade missile launchers, as well as explosives. Your crew introduces the viruses provided by the recon team into their respective systems. After doing this, they steal the highest quality weapon they can find, as well as whatever missiles they can get their hands on.

The facility produces the thick hull plating that makes Coalition ships so resilient. Your crew introduce the viruses provided by the recon into the respective systems. After doing so, they're able to steal some of the plating technology.

The facility produces the advanced reactors that end up in Coalition ships. Your crew introduce the viruses provided by the recon into the respective systems. After doing so, they steal some power cores to install into your ship.

The facility produces the engines for the Coalition. Your crew introduce the viruses provided by the recon into the respective systems. After doing so, they steal some of the technology to upgrade your own engines.

event.name: COALITION_FACILITY_DESTROYED
event.text: The Federation Recon seems satisfied. "We've accomplished an objective to sabotage or destroy the facility. Now all that's left is to get home; we have a lot of intel about Coalition production operations to give to our superiors. We'll shadow you, cloaked, from one jump behind until we get out of this awful place. Best of luck on your mission."

event.name: COALITION_FACILITY_SABOTAGE_AFTERMATH
event.text: "Fantastic job. We'll gather intel from the virus. In sabotaging this facility, they will unknowingly produce defective ships; that ought to throw them for a loop. We'll remain here. Once they figure it out, we'll exploit the vulnerabilities you left behind and finish this place off." They give you a small scrap reward for making their job much easier.

event.name: COALITION_VAMP_DIPLOMAT
event.text: While this beacon provides a break from the oppressive nebula in this sector, you remain on high alert for the Coalition's scouts. However, an unexpected guest arrives shortly after you - a Vampweed ship, with its weapons powered down and comms open.

The Vampweed that answers your hail seems irritated at your presence, but maintains a calm tone as he begins to address you. "Greetings, Federation vessel. Our charts didn't show you as controlling any space near here. Is there anything you need?"

choice.text: Ask what they're doing in Coalition space.

event.text: "Coalition? Ah, that'd explain why we haven't seen a fuel station nearby. Well then, if we shouldn't be here, you certainly shouldn't. Why don't you get out of here, and we'll follow your trail out of this sector?"

"Ah, much obliged, captain. Please, do take the lead, we'll be right behind you." As you spool up the FTL drive, you don't detect any signs that the ship is following you, but you don't have any choice but to trust that they will as you prepare to jump.

choice.text: That's not an answer - press further.

event.text: "Not enough? Fine, that's about what I expected. This is a diplomatic vessel of the Confederacy, on orders to open a line of contact with the Coalition to provide food aid to several planets under quarantine in their jurisdiction. Now, I understand your Federation has their issues with the Coalition, so how about we make this easy? You get some scrap to help you forget that we're here, and some defenseless civilians get the supplies they need. Why let politics get in the way of helping people?"

choice.text: What planets? Where in the sector?

event.text: "Oh, there are several scattered all around the sector. Dreadful business. Our contact has their locations, but I don't think you'd want to stick around and meet them. Now, about that offer?"

"Damn it, you Feds sure are insistent. I'm sorry captain, I know you mean well, but this mission is more important than one Federation ship." The Vampweed cuts the call, and you can see their weapons coming online!
You aren't sure if the Vampweed is lying, but you aren't taking any chances in hostile space. You begin to charge your weapons, and their ship does the same.
You aren't sure if the Vampweed is lying, but you aren't taking any chances in hostile space. You begin to charge your weapons, and their ship does the same.

choice.text: (Mind Control) Demand to know what they're doing there.

event.text: "We were ordered to come to this sector in order to receive a data slate from a Coalition liaison. They said they'd meet us on the edge of the nebula, but we ran into you first."

choice.text: Press him further - who sent them?

event.text: "No clue, but the authorization codes on the order checked out. Would have to have been sent by the premier, or one of his cabinet members. This is all classified though... why am I telling you this, again?" As the Vampweed processes his situation, you can see panic begin to spread across his face, and he seems too stunned to speak further.

The Vampweed on the viewscreen grumbles at your demands, but eventually relents and jettisons a cargo container from their storage. Satisfied, you order your crew to collect the container while you prepare for the next jump.

choice.text: Attack them before they can flee.

event.text: The Coalition doesn't need any more allies against the Federation, and hopefully a messenger going missing will encourage the Confederacy not to push the matter further. You charge weapons and prepare to engage.

choice.text: Leave before they realize they've been controlled.

event.text: You aren't sure how long it'll take for the Vampweed pilot to notice that he's been controlled, but apparently, they haven't figured it out by the time your FTL drive is charged. On to the next mystery.

choice.text: (Ivar) Demand to know what they're doing here.

event.text: "Hrm, funny. I think I would recall if I had ordered a vessel to enter Coalition space. Care to explain what you're doing in this sector?" The Vampweed on the screen cringes in fear, but forces himself to attention as he begins to speak. "Secret diplomatic mission, direct orders from your cabinet. We were told to come to this sector and meet with a Coalition liaison to pick up a data slate. Beyond that, we weren't told much... we aren't in trouble, are we?"
"Of course, of course. Anything for our beloved premier. And if this mission could stay off of our service record, I think we'd all thank you."
"Of course, of course. Anything for our beloved premier. And I don't see any downsides to leaving this ship before punishments are handed down..."

choice.text: Ask them to delay the Rebels.

event.text: "Of course, of course. Anything for our beloved premier. Of course, by doing this, I hope we can expect this awful incident scrubbed from our records..."

choice.text: (Ty E'Rel) Ask what they're doing here.

event.text: At the sight of Ty E'Rel, the Vampweed captain seems stunned into silence, and the ambassador begins to speak. "You came all the way out into Coalition territory without any backup? You're either a fool, or under direct orders from someone who is. Would you care to tell me who sent you here?"

"Ambassador E'Rel, sir! We were ordered to collect a data slate from a Coalition liaison, under direct orders from... someone in the cabinet. Not sure who, but the authorization codes checked out. That said, this entire operation seems off to me. I'd trust you over some faceless cabinet stiff any day. Are you in need of any assistance?
"Of course, of course. I'll order one of my men to send over what we can muster, then we can try and get out of this system before the Coalition spots us. Safe travels, Ambassador."

"Well, I'm not sure I can just give away my crew to a Federation vessel. But at the same time, I don't think my second-in-command will raise too many objections if he receives a surprise promotion. I'll be over shortly, Ambassador."

choice.text: Ask them to delay the Rebels.

event.text: The captain stiffens a bit as the Ambassador delivers your request. "Ah, I see. Well, I can't promise we'll take them head-on, but we should be able to run them in circles for a bit. Safe travels, Ambassador."
You aren't on orders to interrogate every ship you come across. You politely say your goodbyes and prepare to jump.
Whatever their reson for being in this sector, they can't be good. You cut the call and order your crew to charge weapons, and the Vampweed ship responds in turn.
You aren't sure why this ship is here, and it doesn't matter to you. If it's on Coalition territory, it can't have good intentions.
You wait to see if the ship responds to your presence, but you don't detect any changes while you're waiting for the FTL drive to recharge.

event.name: COALITION_HACKER_INFO_BROKER
event.text: A Slug hacker ship arrives right after you. "Jussst who we were looking for, heh heh. We've got sssome premium quality information from around the sssector. We ssstrongly insssissst that you purchasssse sssome. I'll throw in a map for free on purchassse."

choice.text: Buy some information about visitors to the sector.

event.text: "You sssshould keep your eye out for a certain legendary Pirate. If you want to find out where he'ssss gone, look for a distressss beacon within the nebula with no ssship presssence. Glad to have your businessss."

"Sssomewhere in the nebula, there ssshould be a sssship resssponsssible for expanding Coalition territory. It'sss in the nebula, but they know how to masssk their presssence well. Make ssssure you can properly track it, asss it isss quite ssssslippery once sssspotted."
"The Coalition wassss right about you, Federation!" The hacker prepares to defend itself.
"You know what they sssay, Feddy. If you don't pay for the product, then you are the product!" They begin to warm up their engines... they might be planning on selling your whereabouts to the Rebels.

textList.name: INFORMATION_BROKER_RANDOM
textList.text: "Apparently, the Crysssstalssss have devissssed a Mine Launcher who'sss ussse isss not considered bothersssome by the authoritiesss due to the nature of itsss projectilesss. You can find it in their capital worldssss. It doesssn't ussse ammunition either!"
"The Brood ssssometimessss holdssss sssspider racing contessstsss. While they don't allow performance enhancerssss, you might be able to gain an unfair advantage if you did ssssome genetic meddling."
"If you find it, try usssing the Panic Button. It will definitely end the fight right away!"
"That powerful merchant ssssayssss no-no wordssss ssssometimesss. It might be hard to pisssss him off enough to get him to ssssay it, though."

"My sssson issss a technical wizard, you know. Likessss to travel the universssse jusssst like hissss old man. Came up with a unique auto-pilot sssscrambler... Lassst I checked, he wassss doing bussssinessss in a Dynassssty ssssector."

"Ever been to Tony'ssss? If you take out a loan, they'll sssend a certain LaRoache who'll lurk around ssssector exitssss looking for you, to collect on your debt. Loan ssssharking is a frighteningly lucrative bussssinessss, which meansss they can afford to command a vessssel unrivaled by all but one other entrepreneur."

"Did you know that Argeonn sssssmugglessss fugitivessss out of ssssensssitive areassss? I heard one ssssuch ssssmuggler went to the heart of the Harmony. Probably hassss ssssomething to do with the Engi Brigade."

"The Harmony Linkssss are guarded for a reasssson. Ssssuppossssedly, they contain the ssssecret of a realm of unimaginable treassssure. If you don't get killed by the mysterioussss technology that protectssss them, that issss."
"The Rebelssss devote a ssssurprissssing amount of ressssources protecting a ssssector with sssseemingly no tactical value. It musssst mean a lot to ssssomeone important."

"The Black Market guard hassss ssssome valuable information aboard their sssship. If you can get onboard, you could find directionssss to valuable technology. Jusssst err on the sssside of caution if you meet any piratessss."
"The Minisssstry issss asssshamed of itssss hissstory. If you venture into their sssspace, I recommend you keep your eyessss open for their attemptssss to bury their passsst."

event.name: COALITION_ROCK_ENVOY
event.text: You nearly bump into a Theocracy ship as you drop out of FTL. "Hmph. What's the Federation doing here? Stirring up trouble, no doubt. No matter. We have no quarrel with you. This sector is infuriating enough as it is. I'm sure we don't want to be here any more than you do."

choice.text: Ask them why they're here if they'd rather not be.

event.text: "We represent the interests of Theocracy civilians. Honorable Chrysolosists are enslaved and swindled by soldiers in the Hive and civilians from the Kleptocracy." The Rock pauses and makes a small aside. "...The Leeches are fine though, we have no issue with them." He then clears his throat. "Anyway, as disgusting and unacceptable as this is, the Elders have not taken any action to liberate them. We made our demands, but the representatives we met with laughed in our faces."

choice.text: Is there any way we can help?

event.text: "You're... offering help? How is it that the enemies of the Theocracy care more about its civilians than their own allies?" The Rockman grunts. "Fine. You can help. Since dishonesty is the only thing these scum understand, here's how it will go down. We'll send you the location of the station where we met with the representative. You will rough up their station. Then we will come in and 'scare you off'. Deal?"

choice.text: Ignore their statements and attack them.

event.text: "Typical violent heathens! You were only here to shed blood."
"Go back to your home, Renegade. It's doubtless better than here."

event.name: COALITION_ROCK_ENVOY_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: You promised a Rock envoy you'd harass a Coalition station.

event.text: The moment you arrive, the station immediately arms its weapons. The fight begins as soon as you arrive!

event.name: COALITION_FED_AUTO
event.text: You're shocked to see a Federation Auto-ship here. "This ship has been deployed by the Federation to provide relief to soldiers on the Coalition front. It's dangerous to go alone, take this."
"Best of luck Captain." The Auto-ship jumps away.

choice.text: (Upg. Hacking) Disable the Auto and download its data stores.

event.text: You power down the Auto-ship then download all of the data onboard. Seems it has already mapped most of this sector, which is very helpful for you!

choice.text: Attack the ship, there must be more supplies on board.

event.text: "Treachery detected. Activating combat procedures."

event.name: COALITION_FED_AUTO_WIN
event.text: As you scrap the ship, you notice the cargo bay managed to survive the wreckage.

choice.text: (Elite Crew) Have your elite carefully open the door.

event.text: Your crew approaches the storage bay, taking note of a subtle explosive trap to deter pirates. Your crew disables the trap and enters.

As you tear open the cargo bay, you hear a distinct clicking noise. You quickly try to get out of the way but it's too late. The trapped cargo explodes, damaging the ship and destroying all of the cargo and the rest of the Auto-ship wreckage.
You tear open the cargo bay to find excess amounts of resources for you to take.

event.name: COALITION_HEKTAR
event.text: As soon as you arrive, an ear-bleedingly loud advertisement blasts through your ship's stereo. "ATTENTION ALL SHOPPERS! HEKTAR INDUSTRIESSS ISSS PROUD TO ANNOUNCE THE ARRIVAL OF OUR NEW HEKTAR BRAND MILITARY SSSUPPLY DEPOTSSS, OPEN TO ALL COALITION SHIPSSS (or anyone elssse willing to give usss money) SSSO COME IN AND SSSSHOP SSSSHOP SSSSHOP! I DEMAND IT OF YOU!"

"Ah, another brainlesss idi- er... no way, no that'sss right. Another brainlessss idiot who'll give usss their money! Welcome to Hektar Indussstriesss! If you like what you sssee here, conssssider visssiting the Hektar Mega-Market ssssome time in the future!"

"AHAHAHAHAHAHHAHAHAH! HAH! AHAH! Hah... oh boy. An employee dissscount? Are you ssstupid? Hektar doesssn't give employee dissscountsss, it gives employee markupsss! How dare you try and sssteal money from me, you leech!"

choice.text: (Billy) Request a Hektar(tm) brand supply package.

event.text: It only takes a few minutes before Billy returns, and soon after a Hektar package is deposited in your hold. Guess it pays to have the CEO of a major corporation aboard your ship.
Hektar, for as good as their products might be, is a villainous corporation. If they're selling to the Coalition now, then it's your duty to shut them down.
"Hey! Where do you think you're going? I sssaid I DEMAND you come in and sssshop! Damn it, you WILL SSSHOP OR DIE!"

event.name: COALITION_REBEL_STRANDED
event.text: A Rebel ship is stuck at this beacon, with noticeable damage to their engines. They make no attempt to attack you, too heavily damaged to take the risk.
"God damn it, not the Feds. What the hell do you want? If you're going to kill us, make it quick."

The Rebel captain chuckles weakly. "Yeah, right. Well if you're telling the truth, we could use some help with repairs, or some scrap. Took a pretty bad shot from the Coalition guard, and we leaked the fuel all the way here."

The Rebel captain growls, expecting the cargo to be trapped. But when nothing explodes and he's certain theres no infectious murder-bugs inside, he reluctantly thanks you and promises to delay the fleet when he returns to them.

choice.text: Take some time to repair their engines.

event.text: It takes a while, but you're able to patch up the damage. The Rebel captain is surprised at your willingness to help. "Maybe I misjudged you... don't think this changes anything, but it's only right that you are paid for your efforts."

choice.text: (MFK Ace Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel ship to leech supplies.

event.text: You explain the importance of your mission to "stop the Federation" and quickly snap to a salute. To your surprise, the Rebel captain salutes back. "For the glory and for the Rebellion!" Seems their loyalty to the Rebellion is undying even in a desperate situation, though their intelligence is questionable.

choice.text: (Engineer Crew) Pretend to be a Rebel ship to leech supplies.

event.text: You explain the importance of your mission to "stop the Federation" and quickly snap to a salute. To your surprise, the Rebel captain salutes back. "For the glory and for the Rebellion!" Seems their loyalty to the Rebellion is undying even in a desperate situation, though their intelligence is questionable.

You pass over the "scrap" to the Rebels. They pry open the crate to see a ticking bomb that lights their ship ablaze. The captain rushes back to the bridge, coughing. "Ok, you win. Take this garbage and leave us alone."
You take the supplies from them and prepare to leave.
"Yeah, not surprised. Get lost."
With no engines to run away, the Rebel ship is forced to fight you completely stationary.
With no engines to run away, the Rebel ship is forced to fight you completely stationary.
You don't have time to mess with the Rebels too in this dangerous sector. You fly away, and as expected the Rebel ship is powerless to follow.

event.name: COALITION_FREEMANTIS_SLAVES
event.text: Seeing a Free Mantis ship in Coalition space isn't the only unexpected thing at this beacon. It appears the ship has also managed to take a Coalition ship hostage. "Hello friend! Great day today! We have wide selection of crew for you to pick. Taken from fresh Coalition kill!"
The Free Mantis transfer over the Slug slave.
The Free Mantis transfer over the Mantis slave.
The Free Mantis transfer over the Rockman slave.
The Free Mantis transfer over the Leech slave.
"Oh! Federation so kind, so forgiving. You are true hero!" You thank the Free Mantis and leave.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_MANTIS_UNREST
event.text: There seems to be some commotion going on at a nearby Coalition settlement. The planet is broadcasting a message.

choice.text: Tune in to the radio chatter.

event.text: The display shows that several Mantises are holding Slugs and Leeches hostage. A Mantis civilian is angrily ranting, "This planet once proud Hive world! Mantis enjoying warm glow of sun! Now, evil cloud blocks sunshine! Demand nebula destroy!" As this broadcast is happening, the planet-side Slugs and Theocracy law enforcement are exchanging communication about how to break in and rescue the hostages.

Using your ship's combat systems, you bring ruin to the entire settlement, and the planet is unable to defend itself. Coalition or not, the inhabitants were mostly civilians. You harvest the remains of the city.
No need to interrupt the enemy when they are squabbling amongst themselves.

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the Mantises to submit. As the hostages are freed, one of the Slug hostages privately contacts your ship. "I'm tired of living on thisss world of bloodthirssssty maniacsss. Pleasssse, take me with you."

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the Mantises to submit. As the hostages are freed, one of the Leech hostages privately contacts your ship. "Why did my government ever agree to this? I'm sick of it. Please, let me join you."

The Mantises must have a teleporter! They respond to your threat by boarding your ship, carrying whatever supplies they can bring with them. The settlement's law enforcement contacts you as your ship is invaded, telling you it's your problem now.

The Mantises immediately slaughter their hostages. The settlement's law enforcement breaks in to apprehend them, and the ensuing fight ends up with pretty much everyone either dead or dying. Your work here is done.

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the settlement's law enforcement to capitulate. The Mantises demand that the nebula go away, but you explain to them that removing nebulae is not an easy task. Resigned, they petition for resettlement instead. One of them offers to join your crew for your assistance.

The sudden appearance of an unaffiliated ship forces the settlements law enforcement to capitulate. The Mantises slaughter the surrendering officers. and take over the city. "We finding out how to destroy nebula! Also, one of us wanting to join your crew!"
The Rocks are angered by your decision to help the civilians. They respond to your threat by boarding your ship! Out of gratitude, a Mantis teleports up to help you fend off the attackers.

The settlement's law enforcement calls your bluff and decides to raid the Mantis hostage room anyway. The Mantises slaughter the hostages, and both the hostage-takers and the officers are killed in the ensuing struggle. Your work here is done.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_CACHE
event.text: A Leech ship is at this beacon, FTL fully charged. They're broadcasting on an open channel. "Alright you guys, you didn't get your package in time, so we're just gonna leave it here." The Leech's voice quiets to an annoyed mumble. "I hate cache duty." The Leech waits a few more moments before jumping off, leaving the cache behind.
The cache is locked, and it also seems quite sturdy. However, a person familiar with Leeches or the Coalition might know the trick to opening it.
Your crew is familiar enough with the Coalition to know how to open the cache. After verifying their biology and with some quick fiddling, the cache opens.
Tony sighs. "This technology is out of date. But, I'm sure they don't care either way. I know I wouldn't." The cache verifies his biology and pops open.
Alkram nods, opening it with ease, bypassing even the security measures he probably doesn't have to. "We steal these all the time. It's always useful to appropriate your enemy's supplies."
By the time your attacks deal enough damage that the cache opens, whatever's inside is reduced to a melted lump of scrap. Better than nothing.
The Leech cache will likely be found by its intended target, if it's not destroyed by the Rebels.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_ROCK_FAKING_DEATH
event.text: A message seemingly of Theocracy origin is broadcast towards your ship. However, it seems to come from a lone Rock. "At last, an outsider. I am tired of the Theocracy... tired of Chrysolisism, and now I've become tired of the Coalition as well. But still, if I were to defect, I worry that my family would see punishment... so I beg of you - please, help me fake my death." You receive a set of coordinates. "I'm transmitting the location of my encampment. I can get a shuttle. You're going to have to figure out the rest."

choice.text: (Hacking) Falsify logs relating to his death. [-1|]

event.text: You send a hacking probe into the encampment's record log to falsify a shuttle crash, and change his records to be listed as KIA, with the location data set to several sectors away. After his shuttle is out of the encampment's sight, you welcome the outcast aboard, then scrap his shuttle for what little it's worth.

choice.text: (Clone Bay) Who said anything about "faking" your death?

event.text: You invite the Rockman onto your ship. He cocks his head and asks how you intend to fake his death. As your clone bay registers the new passenger, you have him unceremoniously kicked back out of the airlock to smash into the ground below. Moments later, he stumbles out of your clone bay looking very upset. Still, at least the Coalition won't doubt that he's dead.

choice.text: (Ion Weapon) Disable his engines before he clears the planet.

event.text: You fire upon his shuttle. It is ripped it apart just after it clears the atmosphere, leaving the wreck in high orbit. On the plus side, the Coalition troops will technically believe the defecting Rock to be dead. Unfortunately for him, they will be correct. Either way, his shuttle has a modicum of scrap for you to harvest.

choice.text: Pretend to not receive the message.

event.text: You ignore the signal, and there are no further messages from the Rockman.

His shuttle travels up from the encampment. Being a basic, bare-bones shuttle, it's largely defenseless to your attacks; your ion weapon knocks out his engines completely, causing the shuttle to crash land. You manage to get to it before his allies do, finding a low amount of salvage, as well as his body. Thanks to his rock-like biology he is in critical condition, but might pull through with some medical attention.

choice.text: (Upg. Medbay) Give him some medical attention.

event.text: Fortunately, it doesn't take much to nurse him back to health. He looks angry that you almost killed him, but joins your crew all the same.
Fortunately, it doesn't take much to nurse him back to health. He looks angry that you almost killed him, but joins your crew all the same.

choice.text: (Medical Crew) Give him some medical attention.

event.text: Your crew is easily able to patch up his wounds. He looks angry that you almost killed him, but joins your crew all the same.

His shuttle travels up from the encampment. Being a basic, bare-bones shuttle, it's largely defenseless to your attacks; your ion weapon knocks out his engines completely, causing the shuttle to crash land. You manage to get to it before his allies do, finding a low amount of salvage. Unfortunately, he died in the crash, precluding your ability to recruit him.

His shuttle travels up from the encampment. Being a basic, bare-bones shuttle, it's largely defenseless to your attacks; your ion weapon knocks out his engines completely, causing the shuttle to crash land. Unfortunately, it crashes too close to the encampment, meaning that whatever salvage is waiting down there, it won't be yours to harvest.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_AMPERE_TRAINING
event.text: A structure of Leech origin is (poorly) hidden on a planet within this part of the nebula. From afar, it appears to be a training facility. The Coalition is known to have developed a method to turn Leeches to Amperes, and this facility is likely to be related.
You fire from orbit to no avail, as your weapons hardly make a dent.

choice.text: (Ampere Crew) Have your Ampere infiltrate the center.
(Leech Crew) Have your Leech pose as a trainee.

event.text: Alkram manages to pass himself off as one of the Amperes. With a finesse typical of a revolutionary such as himself, he sneaks into the reactor, sabotages it, and leaves. Moments later, the facility starts glowing and shaking before going out in an explosion. Alkram returns with a shuttle, carrying a few things he managed to steal - a weapon and some resources. "Let's get out of here while they try to figure out what's happening."

Tyrdeo hails the training center. "Hello. President Tyrdeo stopping by. I'm gonna have to ask one of you Amperes to accompany me - top secret business. Preferably one of you that doesn't mind occasional contact with people outside of the Coalition." One of the Amperes jumps at the chance to leave Coalition space.

choice.text: (Tony Sr.) Offer an Ampere a small commission to work for you.

event.text: Tony sighs and calls the center. He launches into salesman mode, though keeping the slightly sullen demeanor you know him for. "Hey, are you tired of being stuck here? I can offer you a chance to see worlds beyond, and also fight those slimy Rebels. Any takers?" One of the Amperes jumps at the opportunity.
Given that it's hidden, you are confident they will not pose a threat as you remain at the beacon.

Your Leech enters the center, where most of the staff and other trainees pay them absolutely no mind. When your crew returns to the ship, they mention that they couldn't find any opportunity to sabotage the center, but they managed to steal a bunch of stuff.

Your Leech enters the center, where most of the staff and other trainees pay them absolutely no mind. When your crew returns to the ship, they mention that they couldn't find any opportunity to sabotage the station, but they managed to take something from the hangar on their way out.

Your Leech enters the facility. They stumble into the treatment center, and are mistaken for the latest patient. They return to your ship woozy and numb, but they're an Ampere for the foreseeable future.
Your Leech enters the center, but their suspicious behavior immediately trips an alarm. They manage to escape with their life to your ship, but you detect something...
Your Leech enters, but their suspicious behavior eventually trips an alarm. They're unable to escape - and their lifesigns vanish. Looks like you lost a crew member.

removeCrew.text: Your Leech winces as it stumbles out of the Clone Bay. They're not keen on repeating that.

event.text: Your Ampere enters the center, where they're able to blend in with the staff and make their way to the storage. When your crew returns to the ship, they mention that they weren't able to do much, but they're not going to get the climate control in the center working properly for weeks.

Your Ampere enters the center. They don't find an opportunity to leave the hangar, but they do manage to find the hangar armory, where they manage to convince the armory officer that they're here on behalf of a Coalition ship.

Your Ampere enters the center. When they return, another Ampere is accompanying them. You ask your crew how they convinced them to tag along, but the only response you get is that "You wouldn't get it."
A carefully hidden Ampere vessel reveals itself from behind you. It looks like the Republic has stationed a guard at this facility!
A Leech vessel takes off from the surface. It looks like the Republic has stationed a guard at this facility!
The center immediately sends out a call for help, which attracts the attention of a nearby R.U.E.S.!
The center immediately sends out a call for help, which attracts the attention of a nearby Coalition ship!
You engage the Coalition ship.

choice.text: (Flares) Use the flares to make a distraction so the Civilian ship can escape.

event.text: The Coalition ship notices the flares and redirects its weapons towards them. Even though it quickly realizes it's a trick, the Civilian ship has already flown far away.
You quickly fly away. Soon, the signals coming from the civilians are replaced by the flash of an explosion from their ship.

textList.name: TEXT_COALITION_CIVILIAN
textList.text: You are repeatedly hailed by a nearby civilian ship. You approach it carefully when a Coalition ship flies past, firing at the civilians!
You notice a Coalition ship assaulting a civilian transport. You receive simultaneous hails from both ships, a plea for help and a warning to stay away.
Coalition space is a dangerous place for any ship, so you are not surprised to see the unarmed civilian ship at this beacon under attack from a Coalition ship.

event.name: COALITION_JAILER
event.text: You catch sight of a Coalition Jailer resting nearby. Knowing the Coalition, the ship's prisoners likely consist of mainly Federation officers.
You power up your weapons and engage the Coalition vessel.

Your crew, armed to the teeth, board the Jailer and quickly take down the Coalition crew staffing it. With the jailers turned prisoners, you free everyone locked up who you don't think will kill you immediately.
You aren't in the mood to hole a jailbreak today. You distance yourself from the Jailer.

event.name: COALITION_JAILER_DESTROY
event.text: The Jailer has been destroyed. While an excess of scrap remains, it's very unlikely any prisoners survived.

event.name: COALITION_JAILER_KILL
event.text: The crew of the Jailer has been emptied. You scrap the externals of the ship.
It appears the prisoners did not survive the fight. There's nothing left for you to do except leave.
It appears most of the prisoners died or were severely injured during the fight. One lone survivor stumbles out of his cell, and with some help is healthy enough to work aboard your ship.

choice.text: (Upg. Clone Bay) Try to save some of the prisoners.

event.text: You manage to get DNA samples from a few of the injured prisoners and enter them into the Clone Bay. After reviving them, they thank you and pay you with what little they managed to sneak with them.

choice.text: (Medical Drone) Try to save some of the prisoners.

event.text: Your medical drone is deployed onto the scene, healing many of the other prisoners. After reviving them, they thank you and pay you with what little they managed to sneak with them.
Many of the prisoners appear to have survived. You'll free them all, but you can likely convince one of them to join your crew.

choice.text: We don't need any more crew.

event.name: COALITION_CONSTRUCTION_YARD
event.text: A large Coalition construction yard has been established nearby. It doesn't seem to boast any particularly large ships, but there's a few ships still under construction scattered around.

choice.text: Attempt to access the unconstructed ships.

event.text: As expected, the Coalition isn't going to just let you steal from them without a fight. One of their military vessels is deployed to stop you!

choice.text: (MFK Ace Crew) Attack the construction yard while pretending to be a Rebel.

event.text: You open fire on the construction yard, as the Coalition enforcers engage. You make it pretty clear you're a "Rebel", shouting xenophobic insults alongside your crew member and plenty of hearty 'Glory to the Rebellion!'. You're pretty sure the Coalition gets the message, and they probably won't be so welcoming to the Rebel fleet once it passes by either.

choice.text: (Flares) Launch the flares to distract the Coalition guards.

event.text: Messing with a Coalition construction yard isn't on your agenda for the day, and frankly you'd rather it stay that way.
You quickly move closer to the construction yard and pull apart some of the ships.
You quickly move closer to the construction yard and pull apart some of the ships. Seems some of them were even outfitted with equipment pre-emptively!

You quickly move closer to the construction yard and pull apart some of the ships. On one of them you even find a Leech engineer, who instead of raising the alarm begs to be taken with you to escape the 'insufferable work environment'.

event.name: COALITION_LOSTSUN_CHOICE
event.text: This beacon holds an unusual sight. A rare Lost Sun ship is dueling with a Coalition vessel. Neither seem to notice you.
You power up your weapons and engage the Coalition vessel.
You power up your weapons and engage the Lost Sun vessel.

choice.text: [Federation Database] What do these two have against each other?

event.text: This is a fight you don't want to get involved in. You leave them to their fighting.

event.name: COALITION_LOSTSUN_CHOICE_COALITION
event.text: The Coalition ship has been neutralized. You scrap what remains.

"While Admiral Obadann might be more occupied with the Theocracy, there was a promise made in our alliance. The Federation, while reluctantly, has held their end of the bargain, and so I intend to uphold ours. Perhaps my strength may be of further benefit aboard your vessel."

event.name: COALITION_LOSTSUN_CHOICE_LOSTSUN
event.text: The Lost Sun ship has been neutralized. You scrap what remains.

The Slug captain of the Coalition vessel responds. "The hell issss wrong with you? Aren't you sssuppossssed to be alliesss with them? The Federation really isss full of backssstabbing traitorouss sssscum! Heh. That'sss pretty rad. Here, take sssome crap or whatever."

event.name: COALITION_SLUG_PEACEFUL
event.text: This ship here may not be a Coalition ship, but it's still a Slug! However, they still haven't attacked. "What, ssssuprisssed we aren't itching to fight you? In casssse you didn't know, not every Sssslug likesss thievery and vengeance. We're just here to watch and ssspectate thingsss unfold."
"Great. We come here to esscape from the Kleptocracy ssshithole and inssstead we run into an angry Renegade freak in the middle of Coalition ssspace. What the hell, man."
"Sssure, a deal can be made... It would be cussstomary to charge for thessse, but I'll be nice..."
You ignore the peaceful Slug ship and do something onboard.
"An interesssting offer yesss, but we mussst decline. We wisssh to atleassst sstay neutral with the Coalition, and trading with a Federation sssship isss not a good way to achieve thisss."
"Great. We come here to esscape from the Kleptocracy ssshithole and inssstead we run into an angry Renegade freak in the middle of Coalition ssspace. What the hell, man."
You ignore the peaceful Slug ship and do something onboard.
"Ah, well you've made an offer we can't refussse. If there wasss one ssssstereotype of Ssslugssss that alwaysss fitssssss, it'ss our love for trading."
You engage the Coalition ship.
You quickly fly away. Soon, the signals coming from the civilians are replaced by the flash of an explosion from their ship.

textList.name: TEXT_COALITION_CIVILIAN
textList.text: You are repeatedly hailed by a nearby civilian ship. You approach it carefully when a Coalition ship flies past, firing at the civilians!
You notice a Coalition ship assaulting a civilian transport. You receive simultaneous hails from both ships, a plea for help and a warning to stay away.
Coalition space is a dangerous place for any ship, so you are not surprised to see the unarmed civilian ship at this beacon under attack from a Coalition ship.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_COOL_SLUG
event.text: "Ssssup." You jump and turn around to see a Slug wearing sunglasses "sitting" in a folding chair.
"Wanna know sssomething cool? Thisss was all a dissstraction!" A Coalition ship uncloaks, and the Slug draws his blaster!
"You got an extra sssspacce on your crew? I kinda got booted out of my lassst ssship after I fell assssleep while repairing the life support and asssphyxiated the rest of the crew."
"Ssssweeeet man. You're doing me a real favor here."
"Laaame. Ssssee you never, losssers." He beams away, though you have no idea how.
"Hey man! Not cool. I wassss jussst asking for sssome help, and you gotta do me this way?"
"Ah crap, they found me out!" The saboteur teleports away and a Coalition ship uncloaks, weapons ready!

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_SQUABBLING
event.text:
You catch a conversation between the crew of the nearby elite Coalition ship.
"Told you idiot, this place bad idea go to!"
"Oh ssssshut up, there'sssss nothing wrong with nebulasssss!"
"The weapons need calibrating! BAH! Quit all of your whining and get someone to help me."
"You guys argue more than pops and his three girlfriends! I can't believe this is worse than back home..."

choice.text: Tune in: Nebulas are great for hiding.

event.text: The Slug chuckles. "Hah, thessse guyssss get it! You guysss sssssuck, I'm chilling with the Fedsss now! Later, lossssers."

choice.text: Tune in: Nebulas are horribly annoying.

event.text: The Mantis roars in triumph. "Yes! Someone understand me! I feel so validated! I prove loyalty to new friends by killing old sucky friends!"

choice.text: Tune in: Sounds like a pointless argument that could be solved with lots of guns.

event.text: The Rockman bellows in laughter. "Hahahahahah! I could not agree more. All these idiots want is stealth this, stealth that, but they won't let me just install 30 missile launchers on this thing and blast everyone to oblivion! Maybe you guys will let me pursue my dreams!"

choice.text: Tune in: For a supposedly mighty military force, you all seem awfully uncoordinated.

event.text: The Leech snickers. "Yeah, what the Federation ship said! You guys are no fun, you get your kicks from blowing up civvies! Take that stick out of your assholes and go roll in some mud or something. I'm outta here!"
You distance yourself from the arguing Coalition ship.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_HARVESTING
event.text: While the Coalition ship at this beacon is no surprise, the fact that it is trying to harvest the nebula gasses is! You've never seen a ship try to do this before, but maybe you can steal some from them?
You engage the Coalition ship.
You watch the curious process a little longer before moving deeper into the nebula to hide.
While plenty of salvage is left for you to collect, little remains of the gasses they were collecting, now released back into the nebula around you.
While salvaging the wreckage, you find a few canisters of the gasses, which you bring aboard. You can probably sell this at a store for a lot of scrap.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_COALITION_NEBULA_HARVEST
event.text: After salvaging the externals of the ship, you find several tubes of the gas scattered around the inside, which you collect. You can probably sell these at a store for a lot of scrap.

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_SUZERAIN_CHOICE
event.text:
A Suzerain ship is patrolling this nebula. You catch some chatter between their crew.
"You know, I prefer this place before nebula."
"Yes, agree. Nebulas annoying. How long before Slug bits are attached to ship and we see again?"
You raise your weapons and attack the Suzerain ship.
The Suzerain ship doesn't notice you as you fly away.

event.name: DISTRESS_COALITION_PIRATE_FEAR
event.text: This beacon has a very rare sight. The source of this distress beacon is coming from the pirate ship here! A hyperventilating pirate captain hails you. "Oh god, I'm so sick of this sector. You gotta help us man, no one should be subjected to this torment! I came here to blow up some Civilians and rob some colonies, not have my right hand man sliced in half by a Mantis and my engineer zapped to death by stinky worms!"
You have no sympathy for the pirates. You raise your weapons and attack.
You hand over the supplies to the pirates.
The pirates are shocked that you were willing to help them. They gift you a weapon that they "borrowed" from a previous victim.
The pirate doesn't say anything as you end the call, and doesn't follow when you distance yourself from them.
The pirate stops crying for a moment to glare at you. "Well if you won't be charitable, we'll just take your ship and supplies ourselves!"

event.name: DISTRESS_COALITION_TRAP_BEACON
event.text: "I knew a fool like you would stumble into this trap!" Your Life Support immediately shuts off, suggesting the Coalition ship here is wielding a combat augment against you!
Your Oxygen system is restored to full power.

event.name: DISTRESS_COALITION_FED
event.text: The source of the distress beacon is a Federation ship, running away from its Coalition pursuer.
You engage the Coalition ship.
You fly away from the ships, trying not to think of the inevitable fate of the Federation ship.
The ship you saved was badly damaged in the battle. Most of the crew accepts your offer to be dropped off at a nearby station. One offers to join your crew.
The survivor gets on board the ship.
Apparently the ship that was being assaulted was a transport vessel. They thank you for saving them and offer part of their cargo.
It seems the crew did not survive the assault. You take what you can from the remains of the ship.
They respond, "It's a good thing you came when you did; we'd be dead now otherwise. I'm a shipwright and I'd like to help you like you helped me."

choice.text: The captain offers to install a piece of equipment on your ship.

event.text: "This sector has become increasingly dangerous for the Federation. I think my crew can patch up some of your hull damage as thanks."

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_COALITION_SPILL
event.text: Something is off about the nebula in this beacon. A ways off from your entry is a Coalition ship with its engines disabled emitting a distress signal. Upon your entrance, however, they close their hailing channels.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Find out what's wrong with the nebula.

event.text: Your sensors may not function in the nebula, but they're just functional enough to give you a reading of the nebula itself.

choice.text: (Long-Ranged Scanners) Find out what's wrong with the nebula.

event.text: Your scanners quickly determine the problem with the nebula.
The Coalition ship arms weapons, but doesn't activate their engines.
You leave the Coalition behind. No need to risk a confrontation under strange circumstances.

event.name: COALITION_SPILL_SCAN
event.text: Your ship tells you that the nebula is flammable - there must have been a large fuel spill from the Coalition ship. If you have the right kind of weapon, you might be able to cause a chain reaction.

choice.text: (Fire Weapon) Use a fire weapon to ignite the flammable part of the nebula.

event.text: You throw your engines in reverse and fire your weapon at the ship from afar- in a huge explosion, the enemy ship is badly damaged! They turn their ship to attack yours in retaliation!

choice.text: (Ballistic Fire Weapon) Detonate a fire explosive to ignite the flammable part of the nebula.

event.text: You throw your engines in reverse and fire your weapon at the ship from afar- in a huge explosion, the enemy ship is badly damaged! They turn their ship to attack yours in retaliation!
The Coalition ship arms weapons, but doesn't activate their engines.
You leave the Coalition behind. No need to risk a confrontation under strange circumstances.

event.name: POST_FUEL_SPILL_DETONATION
event.text: Unfortunately, the detonation seems to have spent some of the fuel.

choice.text: (Fuel Conserver) Reprocess the nebula for some extra fuel.

event.name: POST_FUEL_SPILL
event.text: After defeating the enemy ship, you turn your attention to the flammable nebula around the wreckage. You're able to harvest it for a sizable fuel yield.

event.name: NEBULA_DISTRESS_COALITION_SENTINEL
event.text:
It looks like a skirmish is already happening at this beacon. A Crystal Sentinel is fending off multiple Coalition vessels.
A Rockman on the lead ship warns you, "Stay out of this if you want to live, Renegade."
You attack the elite Coalition vessel. "You just sealed your fate, Federation scum!"
The smaller ship directs its energy at you. "Crap, the Renegade issss getting involved!"
You leave the scene behind, hoping that they do not notice you.

event.name: DEFEAT_COALITION_ELITE_CRYSTALS_SAVED
event.text: The R.U.E.S. ship has been vanquished by your superior might. The Coalition vessel leaves behind quite the bounty of wealth.

The Crystal ship has managed to vanquish their own foe. They contact you. "You saved us. We overextended ourselves trying to rescue an SSLG operation that spiraled out of control. For saving us, we can provide you with one of our weapons."

event.name: COALITION_SHELL_WORN
event.text: A worn down Militant Shell vessel hails you. "Who are you and what do you want?"

"Hmphhh! We'll see about thhhhat. We were escorting our scientists, and thhhhey caught us by surprise. Thhhhe scientists are probably still alive... but we shouldn't return home empty handed. If you're really friendly, prove it. Here's thhhheir last known location."

After a short pause, they reply. "Fine thhhhen, Mannan will join you."
"What, because I said I liked thhhe Federation?"
"No, because you screwed up withhh that 'shortcut'."
"This is thhhhe worst sector. We should never come here again."
"Good enoughhh." The Shells promptly hang up.

event.name: SCIENTISTS_ABDUCTED_QUEST

beaconType.unvisitedTooltip: Some Shell scientists have been captured by a Coalition ship.

event.text: The Coalition ship immediately turns towards you. Without hesitation, they attack!

event.name: ABDUCTED_SCIENTISTS_RETRIEVED
event.text: The prisoners are more than happy to be freed from the clutches of the Coalition, but still seem apprehensive.

choice.text: Signal to the escort that the rescue mission was a success.

event.text: The escort jumps in. "You have done what we could not! We'll reward you as much as we can." As you transfer the Scientists aboard the escort's ship, you overhear them complaining about their "idiot captor's" requests.

choice.text: (Shell Crew) Convince the Shells you would make a better escort.

event.text: Your Shell tells the scientists about your exploits and assures them that they will be safe aboard your ship. One of the scientists seems to immediately agree that your ship is better than their old escort.
After thinking for a moment, the other scientist decides to join you too.

choice.text: Convince the Shells that their escort has died.

event.text: "Thhhen thhhhere's no choice... we'll have to join forces." The Scientists look bummed. One of them, resigned, decides to apply for a place on your ship.
After thinking for a moment, the other scientist decides to join you too.

"Fine... we'll have to joi-"
"Thhhey're lying!"
"What? Don't be paranoid."
"We're just being abducted again!" One of them wants to join, but the other is attacking!
They can tell that you are being dishonest. Seeing no other option, one joins you, but the other is entirely non-interactive.
Sensing your dishonesty, they resist your attempt to take them onto your ship. Looks like you blew your chance at a reward.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_COALITION
textList.text: Two Coalition ships appear to be exchanging slaves at this beacon. One of them quickly jumps away after seeing you, but the other attacks!
The Coalition is made of the 4 most hostile races in the galaxy. They aren't known for ignoring a potential fight, and this ship is no exception.
You find a Coalition ship salvaging the wreck of a Federation scout. Upon seeing your ship, it immediately abandons the wreck and attacks!
You are hailed by the captain of a nearby Coalition ship shortly after arriving. "You have a lot of nerve showing up in our sector. Now you will die!"
You see a Coalition ship docked outside a nearby outpost. You order your crew to engage the ship.
The war has brought out the worst in the 4 races that make up the Coalition. The ship at this beacon clearly has no intentions of letting you go unharmed.

"Hehehe, are you lossst? Ssseemsss you wandered too far into Coalition ssspace, buddy! Heheheheheheh, gonna cry about it? Hehehehehehh..." You take this chance to arm the guns while the Slug captain continues to laugh.

The Leech captain on the nearby Coalition ship waves to you. "Sup, man. How's it goin?" He is promptly shoved to the side and replaced by the true captain, a Slug. "You ssstupid tapeworm, we're sssupposssed to fight thessse idiotsss!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_COALITION_ASTEROID
event.text: The nearby Coalition's Rock soldier appears on the vid-screen, noticeably upset. "Bro, why you in my rock patch? Bro, you don't know how hard it was to convince the Coalition to let me have this... bro. Not cool."

event.name: ENCOUNTER_COALITION_PULSAR
event.text: The Pulsar isn't the only obstacle this beacon has. A Coalition ship wastes no time to attack.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_COALITION
textList.text: "You're stuck in this hell too? I'm almost sympathetic, but the Federation is responsible for creating the Coalition!"
A Rebel ship, trying its best to escape from Coalition territory, has decided to take a detour and attack your ship.
The Rebels tend to avoid the Coalition as much as the Federation, but this ship appears to be an exception.
"At last, a ship not filled with alien filth. I'd much prefer to fight Federation scum!"

event.name: COALITION_CHECKPOINT
event.text: A looping message plays over the stereo. "This beacon is a security checkpoint. Submit to processing. If you have nothing to hide, you have nothing to fear." You can hear a Rockman chuckling as the track ends. There's no way they'll let you pass as a Federation ship.
You prepare to fight the checkpoint.
The Coalition station stands no chance at detecting you with your superior cloaking. You slip past completely unnoticed.
With the station completely immobile, you easily speed past them.
By some odds, the station does not detect you as you sneak past.

Whether it was because their scanners were too powerful, or their Slug crew detecting your presence doesn't matter, because the station has detected you and raises its weapons. You doubt cloaking will have any effect now that they know exactly where you are.
There's no doubt the station noticed you, but you're long gone before they can do anything about it.
As you try to fly past, your engines immediately halt. They must be using a combat augment to limit your engines! Unable to escape now, you're forced to fight the station.
Your engine system is restored to full power.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_MANTIS_COALITION
event.text: An eager Mantis contacts you. "Yes! This is chance to prove myself! Your blood is path to leading glorious Coalition ship of own!"

event.name: ENCOUNTER_LEECH_COALITION
event.text: A Leech revolutionary flies past. "Are you even aware of what the Coalition has done to Eargen space? The Federation has done nothing to prevent this chaos! Nothing! It's all YOUR fault! GAAAH! Like, specifically yours. Don't ask me why, just accept your responsibility and die!"

textList.name: TEXT_NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_COALITION
textList.text: The Coalition's alliance with the Slugs means many times their ships can be found crawling around nebulas. This is one such occasion.
It appears a Coalition ship is hiding in this nebula beacon. Upon spotting you they arm their weapons!
A Coalition ship exploring this nebula has found you and attacks!

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_ABDUCTOR
event.text: A Coalition Abductor is hiding in this beacon. They hail you ominously: "Choose your death, travelers. Betrayal by one of your crew, or destruction at our hands?"
"An interesting choice. Enjoy!" One of your crew buckles over, completely mad. They charge you, turned hostile by the Abductor's mind control. The ship quickly slips away into the nebula.
"So you wish to taste the bitter end at the end of our guns? What a great choice!"
"Ah yes yes, you are a skilled negotiator. Silly of me to think such tricks would work on you. Heheh..."
"Ah yes yes, you are a skilled negotiator. Silly of me to think such tricks would work on you. Heheh..."
"Ah yes yes, you are a skilled negotiator. Silly of me to think such tricks would work on you. Heheh..."

event.name: NEBULA_COALITION_CHECKPOINT
event.text: A looping message plays over the stereo. "This beacon is a security checkpoint. Submit to processing. If you have nothing to hide, you have nothing to fear." You can hear a Rockman chuckling as the track ends. There's no way they'll let you pass as a Federation ship.
You prepare to fight the checkpoint.
The Coalition station stands no chance at detecting you with your superior cloaking. You slip past completely unnoticed.
With the station completely immobile, you easily speed past them.

event.name: NEBULA_ENCOUNTER_COALITION_ELITE
event.text: A sinister ship that could easily blend in the nebula catches your attention - it's one of the Coalition's elite fighters! They clearly aren't happy about your presence, and you figure you should waste no time to ready your offensive prowess.

event.name: NEBULA_KAZ_START
event.text: The distress beacon is what brought you here, but this isn't an ordinary scene in front of you. A Slug town, seemingly once under Coalition occupation, has been completely wasted. An ominous scent of rotting bodies drifts through the stale and smokey air. Whatever or whoever did this did it quite clearly out of spite. The Coalition is no friend of yours either, but who would do this?

At first you assume the red smears on the wall are blood, but the Slug inhabitants of this colony would only have bled green. Settling that it's paint, you notice the marking of a claw and a cutlass, painted large and boastfully on the side of the town-hall, which is now less of a hall and more a single wall and some rubble. It's strangely familiar, but you can't remember where you've seen it...

You continue to look through the wastes until you come across a lone survivor. A young Slug, missing one of his eyestalks, is elated to see you. Or at least, as elated as the sole survivor of a genocidal rampage could be. "You- you have to help. The Mantissss, they did thisss... a pirate, but with the banner of the Hive. Pleassse, don't leave me here..."

choice.text: Take the Slug with you and follow the pirate.

event.text: With the coordinates marked on your map, you help the Slug onto your ship and get ready to search for the culprit of this attack.

choice.text: Leave the Slug and this mystery.

event.text: You help the Slug stand up, but apologize and explain you cannot hang around. At the very least, you can offer solace that the chances of the pirate returning are minimal.
Searching for the culprit of this massacre will only put you closer to danger. The only safe course of action is to stay clear of this place.

event.name: KAZ_QUEST

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: Looks like you've found the right location, because the ship in front of you is most certainly a pirate. Just... a very well equipped one.

choice.text: We do not want to mess with this ship.

event.text: Messing with the culprit of this massacre will only put you closer to danger. The only safe course of action is to stay clear of this encounter.

escape.text: "Madness, madness! My legacy does not end here, dying to a Fed with no honor. You are not taking my life today, captain!"

gotaway.text: Kazaaak jumps away, a rare display of cowardice by a Mantis, but apparently you were so unworthy he did not even consider you worthy enough an opponent to die to.

destroyed.text: The once proud and esteemed Mantis warrior has fallen. And for what? His message was not a lie, but without him to tell it, no one else will.

deadCrew.text: The once proud and esteemed Mantis warrior has fallen. And for what? His message was not a lie, but without him to tell it, no one else will.

event.name: KAZ_HAIL
event.text: As soon as the Mantis appears on the screen, the memories come flooding back. This is no ordinary pirate - this is Kazaaakplethkilik. Perhaps the most infamous warrior in the galaxy, if not the Multiverse. The only question is, why is Kazaaakplethkilik here so deep in Coalition space? It seems you're about to find out...

A muscular Mantis in red armor flexes his sharp appendages in front of the camera. "You are not of Coalition, but you carry boldness to approach me. It would seem neither of us meant to be here... What is Federation ship doing in Coalition space? It has been longest time since I have drawn arms against your people."

choice.text: We could ask the same about you.

event.text: "Clever words, but you should know it is foolish not to answer question of Mantis captain. I am here doing what YOU could not. Prized though dear Leikonpliiinakra is to me, she has made grave mistake in forming this 'Coalition'. It is dishonorable, and I can see that it not meant to last. Federation sees it too, but they will not act. They would rather allow Coalition to collapse on itself than take action. You use precious bureaucracy as a shield of responsibility rather than taking action to prevent galactic-scale destruction!"

choice.text: So to solve this you're massacring entire towns?

event.text: "I taking action where no one else would! All filth who live in these lands are far from innocent. They allow Coalition to exist, and so they are no better than the Federation or the Coalition. You are pointing finger but I do not see you taking action. You know not honor. I will show you what warrior of virtues fights like!" It's not impossible you could convince him to stand down, but that means you'll have to fight him like a 'warrior of virtue'. Try not to damage his hull too much, and neutralize enough of his crew that he surrenders.
"Yes, yes. Leave like the cowards you all are. You know what I say is true, and you have not even heart to refute it. I spit in faces of men and women like you."

event.name: KAZ_SURRENDER
event.text: The crew of the mighty warrior Kazaaakplethkilik has been reduced to a sliver of its former size. The wounded warrior still continues to fight on, but you can tell his heart isn't in it anymore. Perhaps this is the time to show him your honor.
"You... you letting me live? I... I do not understand. Is this some Federation trick? You have chance to strike me down, avenge men and women I killed during the war, yet you would let me live?"

choice.text: The Federation-Mantis War was in the past. Neither side was free from blame.

event.text: "Oh do not giving me history lesson. I live through it, I know how things go. Still, so you spare old Mantis. What of Coalition?"

choice.text: The Coalition is a problem, but the Rebellion is a bigger threat.

event.text: "Hmmm, Rebellion. You know, I fight Vance once, long ago. Much slimmer then, but human not fare well after months of concentration camps. Perhaps... perhaps you are right. The Hive and I's approach, while more direct, could be to blame for this Rebellion. Perhaps if we had been more patient and trusting of humanity, Vance never would have turned to genocide."

"You have teaching me, Federation captain. Or at least, I think. Perhaps I have lessons yet to learn, as I'm sure you do as well. But now that my crew has been slaughtered and I am without purpose, maybe it's time I repent for my mistakes. I have no need for this ship of mine any longer. Perhaps it will service you better."
"Asking one more favor of you, captain, if you are not minding. I wish to return to Hive, speak with queen. I am giving you coordinates now, in case we are not finding it on journeys."

event.name: NEBULA_COALITIONHOLD_CEALAFORMER_1
event.text: The nebula at this beacon is very thick. Too thick, in fact. You can just barely make out part of a ship slipping through the nebula. You're being followed.

The ship that comes out of the nebula is no ship you've ever seen or heard of before. Despite being armed as well as any other military ship, the ship hastily moves to escape as soon as you discover its presence!

event.name: NEBULA_COALITIONHOLD_CEALAFORMER_2
event.text: The ship's speedy retreat has left you very confused.

choice.text: (Upg. Sensors) Lock onto their jump signature and follow them.

event.text: Luckily, you're able to pick up their jump signature. You enter their new co-ordinates into your database.

choice.text: (Slug Crew) Have your Slug track their ship.

event.text: Luckily, your Slug is able to detect their jump signature. You enter their new co-ordinates into your database.

event.name: COALITIONHOLD_CEALAFORMER_3

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: You've tracked down the strange ship - but your destination isn't quite what you expected. In the middle of an ion storm, you find a rogue planet submerged entirely in darkness except for a glowing spire and fields of tesla coils drawing power from the storm. A warning appears on your screen; "Warning: you are approaching a restricted zone. Only authorized Coalition personnel may enter."

As you move closer to the spire, you're stopped by an approaching ship - the same as you saw earlier! Now that you have time to scan it properly, it seems it's using tech similar to the cealaforming stations deployed by the Kleptocracy - except mobile! This must be where the artificial nebulas in this sector came from! To figure out the mystery behind the giant structure in the distance, you'll have to take care of this ship first.
This must be some kind of secret Coalition facility - far too risky to even consider approaching armed the way you are.

event.name: COALITIONHOLD_CEALAFORMER_4
event.text: It seems most of the lower levels of the structure were already evacuated... or maybe never even populated at all. The whole place is strangely empty.

You push forward, exploring empty hallway after empty hallway, barren room after barren room. Laboratories filled with shelves that are empty, even hangars with nothing but a few scattered trollies. There's no signs of a struggle nor any bodies, so you can only make one assumption. This place was built in preparation of something, some plan that hasn't yet come to fruition. But what could it be?

choice.text: There must be something here - keep looking!

event.text: You do another once-over of the facility, searching for any clues. It takes some time, but eventually you come across a secret compartment that leads deeper underground. The security systems look unfinished, so the Coalition must have been relying on the secrecy of this location as protection for the time being.

The secret room reveals itself to be some kind of meeting room. 4 ornate chairs encircle a large holotable - one for the leader of all 4 factions within the Coalition. A door behind the table leads into a huge cathedral-like space. There's so many things to look through, but first you head over to the most obvious. An unfinished frame and blueprints for a prototype Coalition cruiser - something to compete with the Federation and Rebellion's own advanced warships. You make scans of the blueprints then set fire to them. This should set the Coalition back a bit, though they probably have copies.

choice.text: Take a look at the rest of the room.

event.text: The rest of the room is filled with ruins of some ancient technology made from Aether, similar to that of the vessel the first Multiverse drive was reverse engineered from. On the table are papers with partial translations of the alien hieroglyphics, detailing strange and worrying descriptions of "doomsday bombs", "reality altering monoliths", and a drawing of a cubical robot with a single eye. You heard the Coalition recovered some precursor tech during the Aquarian invasions, but you had no idea their research was this in-depth. You don't have time to bring all of this back to the ship, but you grab one of the seemingly functional weapons to bring with you.
You don't have time to keep digging through everything in this facility. You've already found vital information to assist the Federation - that's good enough.

choice.text: We can only hope that, whatever it is, it never comes to be.

event.text: Assuming you live, you'll have to bring this up to your superiors at the Federation. For now though, you must carry on with your mission.
